title: GIVEAWAY: Take Our Survey for a Chance to Win a Pair of Favero Assioma Power Meter Pedals
content:
BikeTiresDirect will give one lucky winner their choice of a pair of Favero Assioma DUO Double-Sided Power Meter Pedals or Favero Assioma PRO MX-2 Power Meter Pedals.

Whether you ride road, gravel, or mountain — Favero Assioma makes power meter pedals to handle the conditions. In short, the DUO double-sided pedals are for roadies and the PRO MX-2 are for off-road.

In addition to power meters, BikeTiresDirect is home to the world’s best selection of bicycle tires, plus tons of other cycling gear. Explore their collection of complete bikes, components, apparel, accessories, computers, and much more. Be sure to check out The BikeTiresDirect Instagram and YouTube for product launches, features & community content!

Answer the short survey from the folks at BikeTiresDirect for a chance to win, and read more about the two power pedals you can choose from if you’re the lucky winner below!

Favero Assioma Power Meter Pedals

Favero Assioma DUO Double-Sided Power Meter Pedals are designed for high-performance road training sessions and are LOOK Keo cleat compatible. Each pedal has a power sensor to provide instantaneous Angular Velocity (REAL) data instead of an average velocity. That’s because of the exclusive IAV Power system tech and an integrated gyroscope used for its data. The power meter pedals also incorporate the temperature and weather conditions when measuring watts.

The pedals connect via Bluetooth and ANT+ providing up to 50 hours of pedaling before recharging. These are Favero’s lightest and most compact pedal-based power meters, which are waterproof and shock-resistant.

The Favero Assioma PRO MX-2 Power Meter Pedals are made for MTB and gravel rides and are SPD-compatible. They have integrated rechargeable batteries that last 60+ hours on a single charge and connect via Bluetooth or ANT+ to be compatible with most apps, watches, and cycling computers.

The pedal body is 6061-T6 aluminum so it’s both light and sturdy when you take on all kinds of trails. Like other pedals, these can be swapped to other bikes.

So how do you win a pair? Answer the questions below for your chance!
